France: Race War Rages in France for Eighth Day
 
 Cabinet minister: Rioting is "well-organized," spreading; White woman burned alive by non-Whites.
 
 PARIS, FRANCE -- French Interior Minister Nicolas Sarkozy said Thursday that the riots raging for the past eight days in several Paris suburb were "not spontaneous" but rather "well organized."
 
 "What we saw in the department of Seine-Saint-Denis overnight was not spontaneous, it was perfectly organized," Sarkozy told French news channel i-tele.
 
 The riots have also taken on an increasingly dangerous tone, with buckshot fired at riot squad vans -- and prosecutors revealing that a handicapped French woman was deliberately set on fire the night before.
